mads.note: Huschke, P. Iurisprudentiae anteiustinianae reliquiae, 1908: p. 46 (L. Iulius Caesar, consul, 690 [64 B.C.])

Pauly-Wissowa: 19. Bd., col. 468-471, "Iulius", #143 (L. Iulius Caesar, master of the mint, 90 B.C., questor of Asia, 77 B.C., consul 64 B.C., legate of Caesar in Gaul, 52-49 B.C., prefect of Rome, 47 B.C., proscribed after the death of Caesar, saved by his sister Julia)

Oxford class. dict., 1st ed.: p. 154 (Caesar, Lucius Julius, consul 64 B.C., son of Lucius Julius Caesar (consul 90 B.C.) and uncle of M. Antonius,duumvir perduellionus, 63 B.C., legate of Caesar in Gaul, 52-49 B.C., prefect of Rome, 47 B.C., saved by his sister Julia after the death of Caesar)

Dict. of Greek and Roman biog. and mythology, 1967: v. 1, p. 538, "Caesar," #11 (L. Julius L.f.L.N. Caesar, uncle of M. Antony the triumvir by his sister Julia, consul 64 B.C., legate of Caesar in Gaul, 52-49 B.C., made prefect of Rome by Antony, 47 B.C., proscribed in 43 B.C. and pardoned by Antony at the entreaty of Julia, no further mention after this)
